unnormalised: **Urban Gym Culture: Sweat, Selfies, and Samosas (Sometimes)**
normalised: **Urban Gym Culture: Sweat, Selfies, and Samosas (Sometimes)**

unnormalised: Hey guys, ever noticed how gym culture has just exploded in Indian cities? From Delhi to Chennai, everyone's hitting the weights, pounding the treadmill, and posting their progress on Insta. It's become a whole *thing*, right?
normalised: Hey guys, ever noticed how gym culture has just exploded in Indian cities? From Delhi to Chennai, everyone's hitting the weights, pounding the treadmill, and posting their progress on Insta. It's become a whole *thing*, right?

unnormalised: I remember back in college, at IIT Bombay, the gym was practically deserted. Now? You're lucky to find a free bench press after 6 pm. And forget about the morning rush – it’s a scene!
normalised: I remember back in college, at I I T Bombay, the gym was practically deserted. Now? You're lucky to find a free bench press after six p m. And forget about the morning rush – it’s a scene!

unnormalised: But it's not just about getting ripped anymore. It's a lifestyle. Think protein shakes, pre-workout supplements (beware those!), and the constant quest for the perfect gym selfie. You'll see more branded activewear than at a sports store! Brands like HRX are killing it, no doubt.
normalised: But it's not just about getting ripped anymore. It's a lifestyle. Think protein shakes, pre-workout supplements (beware those!), and the constant quest for the perfect gym selfie. You'll see more branded activewear than at a sports store! Brands like H R X are killing it, no doubt.

unnormalised: It’s also fascinating to see the diverse fitness trends. You've got the hardcore bodybuilders, the CrossFit junkies, the yoga enthusiasts, and even the folks just trying to burn off that extra biryani from Sunday lunch. I even saw a group doing Bhangra-inspired Zumba once! Talk about fusion fitness.
normalised: It’s also fascinating to see the diverse fitness trends. You've got the hardcore bodybuilders, the Cross Fit junkies, the yoga enthusiasts, and even the folks just trying to burn off that extra biryani from Sunday lunch. I even saw a group doing Bhangra-inspired Zumba once! Talk about fusion fitness.

unnormalised: Speaking of food, that's where things get tricky. I mean, how do you resist all the deliciousness during festivals like Onam? Or those crispy samosas at the corner shop? The struggle is real! Finding a balance is key – maybe a little bit of everything in moderation, eh?
normalised: Speaking of food, that's where things get tricky. I mean, how do you resist all the deliciousness during festivals like Onam? Or those crispy samosas at the corner shop? The struggle is real! Finding a balance is key – maybe a little bit of everything in moderation, eh?

unnormalised: The best part? It's become a community. People motivating each other, sharing workout tips, and even forming friendships. You see groups running 5kMs together in Cubbon Park every Sunday. And that sense of camaraderie is pretty cool, makes those early morning workouts a lot less painful.
normalised: The best part? It's become a community. People motivating each other, sharing workout tips, and even forming friendships. You see groups running five kilometers together in Cubbon Park every Sunday. And that sense of camaraderie is pretty cool, makes those early morning workouts a lot less painful.

unnormalised: But seriously, guys, don’t get too caught up in the Instagram hype. Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and hydrate, hydrate, hydrate! You don't want to end up with Rs. 5000 worth of physio bills, trust me.
normalised: But seriously, guys, don’t get too caught up in the Instagram hype. Remember to listen to your body, prioritize proper form, and hydrate, hydrate, hydrate! You don't want to end up with rupee five thousand worth of physio bills, trust me.

unnormalised: So, what are your thoughts on the urban gym scene? Any funny gym stories to share? Let me know in the comments!
normalised: So, what are your thoughts on the urban gym scene? Any funny gym stories to share? Let me know in the comments!
